pullRequest.title: [#10297] Tooltips behaviour improvement
pullRequest.bodyText:
Part of #10297 New tooltip applies 400ms delay for tooltip to appear, with 100ms delay on fade. Applies underline on text on hover to show that there is a tooltip. (underlines are supposed to be dotted) Only texts have grey dotted underline to indicate that they have tooltips. Icons would always have tooltips, and buttons may or may not have tooltips. Removed tooltips that doesn't provide additional information, as well as change the wordings of tooltips to be more concise. Also repositioned placements of tooltips be placed more accurately over the right element. nodes.bodyText:
tool-tip-decorate is a hard-coded class from us, not what is pre-added by Bootstrap. You need to find some other selector if you want to truly target all tooltips.
Also, the effect should not only display on hover (otherwise nobody knows there is a tooltip). What hovering can do, instead, is making the effect more pronounced (e.g. darken the border colour on hover).
I don't think border-bottom is what we're looking for here. Instead, it would be text-decoration.
Bolding the text has a rather surprising effect. Let's make the effect more subtle, e.g. just make the underline colour darker (e.g. #808080 to #404040).

If this is aiming to suppress the decoration on Fontawesome icons, this is too generic.
Fontawesome icons work by either one of these classes: fa, fas, far, fab, fal, so those are what you should target. fa is deprecated and should be changed, but that's another story.
These tool-tip-decorate classes are no longer useful now?
